section.title: Expense Entry Screen
section.para: When selecting a Line, the following screen will appear:

Expense Entry
When entering an Expense Entry, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: This displays the Sheet you are currently maintaining.
This displays the Line you are currently maintaining.
Select Time or Expense (the fields change accordingly)
The date of the Sheet you are currently maintaining. There is a single Sheet Date per Sheet. The Work Date can vary by Line. Example: You may choose to bill for a month of working.
The date of the actual expense was incurred.

note.para: There is a single Sheet Date per Sheet. The Work Date can vary by Line. Example: You may chose to bill for a month of expenses.

listitem.para: This is populated from the value provided on the Sheet.
The number of units being expensed.
The rate is derived from the Item List Price.
This is the extended value from Qty x Rate.
Check this box if the entry is prepaid. A prepaid entry is assumed to not be reimburseable. In the Pro version, this value will prevent the entry from being vouchered.
Check this box if the entry is billable. In the Pro version, the entry will be invoiced when this is checked.
This is the Customer number.
This is the Customer PO number. This is a free-form field. In the Pro version, Invoice Consolidation will make use of this value.
This is the Item number. This will list all Reference items that are also Expense items.
This is the Project Number.
This is the Task. If a task isn't found, a DEFAULT task will be created.
These are the Planned Hours as setup in the Project/Task.
These are the Actual Hours, compiled from Time entries.
These are the Planned Expenses as setup in the Project/Task.
These are the Actual Expenses, compiled from Expense entries.
In the Pro version, these Notes will passed along to the Voucher Distributions.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Runs the report associated with this screen.
Highlight a record and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the record.
